page.title: 15WILBARSTON PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: The school at Wilbarston is at the end of the village,surrounded by open countryside. The new building dates from 1977 but the old one is still used for the infants and as a resources centre. There are five classes with five full time teachers and one part time including the headmaster who has been there for eighteen years. There are 121 children and they come from Wilbarston,Middleton,East Carlton,Ashley,Stoke Albany,Sutton Bassett,Dingley,Weston by Welland and Brampton Ash. The children study the Fletcher Mathematics Scheme and the Ginn 360 Reading Scheme. A strict timetable is not followed apart from the use of the hall. About 45 children have school dinners (55p) and the same number packed lunch.
